Class ncsa.hdf.object.H4Accessory 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----ncsa.hdf.object.H4Accessory
public final class H4Accessory
extends java.lang.Object
The H4Accessory class provides common static methods to HDF4 objects.

Version:
1.0 12/12/2001
Author:
Peter X. Cao, NCSA

H4Accessory()
 

allocateArray(int, int)
Allocate a 1D array large enough to hold a multidimensional array of 'datasize' elements of 'dataType' numbers.
getDatatypeDescription(int)
Returns the short description of datatype.
getFileAnnotation(int, List)
Reads HDF file annontation (file labels and descriptions) into memory.
getGRglobleAttribute(int, List)
Reads GR globle attributes into memory.
getSDSglobleAttribute(int, List)
Reads SDS globle attributes into memory.

H4Accessory
public H4Accessory()

getFileAnnotation
public static final java.util.List getFileAnnotation(int fid,
                                           java.util.List attrList) throws HDFException
          Reads HDF file annontation (file labels and descriptions) into memory. The file annotation is stroed as attribute of the root group.

Parameters:
fid - the file identifier.
attrList - the list of attributes.
Returns:
the updated attribute list.
getGRglobleAttribute
public static final java.util.List getGRglobleAttribute(int grid,
                                              java.util.List attrList) throws HDFException
          Reads GR globle attributes into memory. The attributes sre stroed as attributes of the root group.

Parameters:
grid - the GR identifier.
attrList - the list of attributes.
Returns:
the updated attribute list.
getSDSglobleAttribute
public static final java.util.List getSDSglobleAttribute(int sdid,
                                               java.util.List attrList) throws HDFException
          Reads SDS globle attributes into memory. The attributes sre stroed as attributes of the root group.

Parameters:
sdid - the SD identifier.
attrList - the list of attributes.
Returns:
the updated attribute list.
allocateArray
public static final java.lang.Object allocateArray(int dataType,
                                         int datasize)
          Allocate a 1D array large enough to hold a multidimensional array of 'datasize' elements of 'dataType' numbers.
Parameters:
dataType - the data type
datasize - the size of the data array
Returns:
an array of 'datasize' numbers of dataType.
getDatatypeDescription
public static final java.lang.String getDatatypeDescription(int dataType)
          Returns the short description of datatype.

Parameters:
dataType - the data type.
